text: my decision to apply at HBS wasn't a
decision that I made overnight I was the
kind of girl who dreamt about going to
college and dreamt about going to
graduate school even dreamt about going
to an Ivy League graduate school however
I don't come from a place where they are
Ivy League examples just walking around
in funded Li but with the love and
support of my family and my friends I
have been able to make myself an example
for others in the future so I said
academic goals for myself and when I
graduated from Hampton University summa
laude I said well you've pretty much
done everything he wanted to do but can
you do this you know can you apply and
be admitted to Harvard Business School
so I tried but it might not have been
possible had I not believed in myself it
might not have been possible if I hadn't
attended prospective students Day which
is an event that HBS holds every year
for prospective students I arrived to
the campus I've never been in Boston I
could see my dream I could touch my
dream and feel it but it wasn't mine yet
and I hadn't earned it at the moment I
was caught with feelings that of
stereotypes of HBS that you know maybe I
wouldn't fit in maybe the students would
be stuck-up or cocky I didn't know but
something very small happened to me and
it really really changed my perspective
on HBS and I was young prospective
student and lost walking through the
hallways of our judge Hall looking for
my classroom for the event and someone
stopped and said you know do you need
help can I help you find something
and it just broke the ice that I had
with HBS and just made me realize that
people are friendly people really do
care and people are looking out to help
you so there are very few days that I
would say our life changing but January
16 2008 was a life-changing day for me
and it started off I went to work in the
morning at about 10 o'clock in the
morning my father called me and he said
did you check yet I said there's nothing
online I don't know I haven't heard
anything and I was a tutor for two
middle school girls so I had to leave my
desk leave my computer and go tutor them
so I'm away back he caught me again I'm
like it's not very like
looking of trying it's not there yet so
finally I did see it and I clicked on
the link and said you know you have been
admitted to the Harvard Business School
and get a class of 2010 and Here I am at
work I screamed I didn't care who saw me
I didn't care who hurt me I was just so
excited so proud and that day changed my
life because as of that day I was an
admitted student to Harvard Business
School and I promise you that's
life-changing I applied to Harvard
Business School even though I didn't
have an 800 GMAT or 700 GMAT and I won't
go any lower than that and you know I
applied even though I don't have a
banking background or you know even
though I didn't have multiple years of
work experience I was just heading over
the heading towards a year and a half
mark but you know every time I came to
HPS they said oh we look at the whole
person you know really we really want to
know you and your GMAT score your GPA is
just one component of your total
application I said well then they have
to like me because I'm really trying to
do big things here I'm leaving work
every week to tutor students I'm really
trying to make a change so you know you
can go to many places and you can say
that you want to change the world or you
want to do something drastic and it's
cliche but here at HBS it's not cliche
it's real and they will give you the
resources that you need to do well the
resources that you need to succeed and
literally anything that you set your
mind to I believe that it can be done
with HBS and now that I'm here it's not
easy you know the case methods giving me
trouble I don't know where my learning
curves going I don't understand I'm
worried about midterms that are coming
up but I believe that I'll be okay and
you know I never forget where I am I
never forget how grateful and what a
great opportunity it is to be here and I
never forget about the family the
friends everyone who read my essays
everyone just called me as I got
rejection letter after rejection letter
because I applied to HBS first her back
from HBS last and that was the only
school that I was accepted to so that
was a challenge for me but I'm here and
I encourage anyone who wants to come and
not let one aspect of maybe their
application such as a GMAT score or GPA
or maybe tradition a non-traditional
background I would tell them not to let
that bother them because HBS you know
has an entire
your admission staff and they will
determine who will get in and who will
not get in and you can apply to HBS and
not be admitted but if you don't apply
you will definitely not be admitted so I
always encourage others not to discount
themselves and that you know if you
think that you have the whole package
and that you can do well here to come
and try because if you get in you will
do well and you will be successful
